page.title: 06M11 Motorway Traffic Census
page.content: On the{4th July}our class went to the footbridge between Thriplow and Whittlesford, for a traffic census to see how many vehicles were going towards the{north}and{south.}Our teacher said that we should first do a practice count for 30 seconds. At {11:35}we started the real{5 minute count. One group of children counted all the vehicles going south, another counted those going north. We divided the groups into 3 sections, to count cars, lorries, and other vehicles. Altogether there were{90}vehicles going{south}towards{London; 43 cars, {31 lorries, 1 motorcycle, 10 vans, 1 {car and trailor and 4 cars and {caravans.}On the north-heading side of the road there were{77}vehicles;{54 {cars ,19 lorries, 1 motorcycle, 2 vans {and 1 coach.}A Grand Total of{167 vehicles passed under the bridge.
